alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 9:18AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wood and northern Hancock Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 918 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McComb, or 9 miles east of Ottawa, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Findlay, North Baltimore, McComb, Arcadia, Rawson, Van Buren, Bloomdale, Cygnet, Portage, Jerry City, Hoytville, Benton Ridge and Bairdstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
